body_html:
Hm, connecting this back to now what I think your original request is, that you want to avoid having the input to 'x' be a well known shape, I think I understand why you want this. It seems plausible to add the identity gradient for placeholder_with_default.

cc @mrry who added placeholder_with_default

It might also be possible to set the shape of 'x' in python using set_shape() to something that has an unknown shape or partially unknown shape before connecting it to D.

body:
Hm, connecting this back to now what I think your original request is, that you want to avoid having the input to 'x' be a well known shape, I think I understand why you want this.  It seems plausible to add the identity gradient for placeholder_with_default.

cc @mrry who added placeholder_with_default

It might also be possible to set the shape of 'x' in python using set_shape() to something that has an unknown shape or partially unknown shape before connecting it to D.
